etymologies: Latin, literally ‘I do not wish to contend’

definitions: a plea by which a defendant in a criminal prosecution accepts conviction as though a guilty plea had been entered but does not admit guilt

examples.text: the majority of these entering pleas of nolo contendere
the defendant pleaded nolo contendere to a single charge of income tax evasion

shortDefinitions: plea by which defendant in criminal prosecution accepts conviction but does not plead or admit guilt
